alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 1:16AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Hancock, southeastern Van Buren, southwestern Lee and central Clark Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 116 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Croton, or 9 miles north of Kahoka, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Donnellson around 125 AM CDT. St. Francisville around 130 AM CDT. New Boston around 135 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Nauvoo, Montrose, Keokuk, Hamilton, Ferris and Adrian. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern Iowa.
